verb.description: Convey (a thought or feeling) in words or by gestures and conduct.

examples: she would express her milk using a pump and take it home for her baby

verb.description: Cause (an inherited characteristic or gene) to appear in a phenotype.

examples: express elevators take you directly to the eighth floor

adverb.description: By express train or delivery service.
examples: I got my wife to send my gloves express to the hotel

noun.description: An express train or other vehicle of public transportation.
examples: we embarked for the south of France on an overnight express

noun.description: An overnight or rapid delivery service.

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French expres, from Latin expressus distinctly presented, past participle of exprimere press out, from ex- out + primere press.
